required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

id_info.org_study_id: New York Eye and Ear Infirmary

clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Fat Grafting With PRP (Platelet Rich Plasma) to Anophthalmic Sockets
clinical_study.official_title: Autologous Fat Grafting to Anophthalmic Sockets With PRP (Platelet Rich Plasma) Using a Closed Cannula Technique

brief_summary.textblock: After people lose an eye, for whatever reason, they often experience fat atrophy of the tissues in the orbit. This leads to a sunken appearance that is often not correctable by a cosmetic shell prosthesis. Current techniques to correct this deformity are inadequate/ invasive. Injection of various gels (Restylane, Radiesse) are temporary had have their own disadvantages. This study seeks to demonstrate an improvement in the retention of injected autologous fat by mixing in autologous PRP (platelet rich plasma).

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Improved retention of autologous fat injected into anophthalmic sockets
primary_outcome.description: Non contrast MRIs of the orbits are obtained before, immediately after, and one year after injection of autologous fat mixed with autologous PRP (platelet rich plasma)

arm_group.arm_group_label: autologous fat grafting with PRP to anophthalmic orbits
arm_group.description: There is only one arm to this study. People with orbital atrophy and loss of an eye are to be injected with autologous fat mixed with autologous PRP (platelet rich plasma) and observed for one year for evidence of retention of the injected fat

intervention.intervention_name: autologous fat grafting with PRP to anophthalmic orbits
intervention.arm_group_label: autologous fat grafting with PRP to anophthalmic orbits

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: anophthalmos, orbital atrophy -
Exclusion Criteria:poor anesthesia risk, people outside a 100 mile radius of New York City
-

facility.name: New York Eye and Ear Infirmary
New York Eye and Ear Infirmary
